items.title: Decentraland: Senior Technical Writer
items.content:
Senior Technical Writer

Posted May 13

Decentraland
Headquarters: Remote
decentraland.org
View all Decentraland jobs →

We are looking for a versatile writer to join our Content and Marketing team to help write Decentraland’s blog posts, product announcements, press releases, and documentation. We are at the forefront of WebVR and blockchain technology: our foundation in this cutting-edge, developing technology requires that we provide our users with the clearest and most accessible content possible.

We are seeking a writer with previous experience writing marketing and technical content for a developer audience. However, our ideal candidate will possess a general writing skill set and the ability to adapt their tone and style to fit a wide range of genres and audiences -- all while staying true to Decentraland’s image as a brand and organization. The ability to perform independent research, interview subject matter experts, and write collaboratively with other content contributors are all equally critical to success in this role.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with the content and marketing teams to write weekly blog posts and newsletters describing the Decentraland team’s most recent developments.

  • Write blog posts covering a range of topics related to the Decentraland platform. This could include WebVR development, Ethereum, user experience and design in virtual reality, blockchain-based cryptography and security, cryptocurrencies, and blockchain-based gaming.

  • Help with the creation of technical and non-technical documentation, like tutorials for our developer tools, FAQs, and technical reference documentation for our API.

  • Help with the creation of marketing content for publication across each of our social media channels.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Fluency in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • A working knowledge of blockchain technology and the Ethereum ecosystem

  • A desire to work with a distributed, fast-moving team!

Recommended Qualifications:

  • A voracious attention to detail and meticulous writing and editing skills

  • Experience writing technical documentation for a developer audience

  • Experience writing on a content marketing team

  • Strong familiarity with the communities surrounding Ethereum, cryptocurrencies, and crypto-collectibles

  • Experience and comfort working on a distributed team

Apply for this position

Send us your resumé and work samples (blogs, documentation, etc) to jobs@decentraland.org. We will get back to you shortly :).

items.title: Animalz: Content Manager
items.content:
Content Manager

Posted May 11

Animalz
Headquarters: New York, NY
https://animalz.breezy.hr/p/890c4d42e71401-content-manager?source=weworkremotely
View all Animalz jobs →

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies—particularly B2B SaaS businesses—grow by making great content that their audience loves.

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover.

You could be:
  • an experienced content marketer looking to take your career to the next level
  • a journalist looking to make a career switch
  • a digital marketer looking to hone in on content marketing
  • an aspiring entrepreneur who wants to learn more about technology
An ideal content manager at Animalz:
  • deeply passionate about writing and approach all forms of content with a creatively curious mindset
  • write clearly, concisely, and in an organized way
  • have a marketing sense for storytelling
  • understand the business side of writing
  • well-organized, independently motivated and loves working directly with customers
  • is fascinated by the role technology plays in our day-to-day lives and the ways it continues to shape our future.
Responsibilities:

  • Compose, revise and deliver 2-4 blog posts per week
  • manage 2-4 customers
  • help craft and pitch ideas
  • content strategy
  • promotion
  • help the team learn from your customers by celebrating wins and sharing opportunities
About Animalz

We’re a remote team with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world. We have an eclectic team of current and former scientists, journalists, operations folks, and more.

Apply for this position

https://animalz.breezy.hr/p/890c4d42e71401-content-manager?source=weworkremotely

items.title: fly.io: Writer, Content Creator, Dev Advocate
items.content:
Full-time

(Chicago, IL)

fly.io is an open core, programmable CDN. Developers write JavaScript Edge Applications locally, test them, and deploy across our global network of servers.

We're hiring to improve our publishing! You might want to apply if you enjoy JavaScript and writing for developers. You'll be really good for this role if you can come up with interesting ideas and turn them into finished content. We're remote first, and super flexible, so you hopefully like talking to other people on Slack and getting together with the rest of the company every few months. If you like giving talks and going to conferences, you can do that too (but it's not a requirement)!

Example content:

  • https://fly.io/articles/fly-edge-apps-advanced-http-routing/
  • https://onehostname.com

Salary is is competitive (they require we enter compensation on our posting, but that is not necessarily the bucket), our equity grants are relatively large (up to 2% of the company), and we offer health benefits for US based employees.

 

Apply: To apply, send an email to jobs@fly.io. Please include a developer focused writing sample, and links to any code you've written.

items.title: Technical Writer needed for contract work - remote working possible at Croud (Shrewsbury, UK)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level
Industry: Digital Agency
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

OVERALL PURPOSE OF THE ROLE:

Capable and experienced Technical Writer required for a fast growing and technically driven digital marketing agency. The role, which is based in the Shrewsbury office, is key to Croud achieving their goal of developing an unparalleled Digital Marketing application platform. The Platform itself is based on years of experience delivering tools and services directly to an Agency and gathering feedback via close interaction with the Agency employees. Croud Inc Ltd are now looking to consolidate those learnings and produce a dedicated platform that will expose those tools and services via a number of different of channels including SaaS and BTC. We need a best in class Technical Writer to product world class documentation from the outset such that we can build out the platform vision without compromise.

MAIN ACTIVITIES / TASKS:

  • Develops a thorough understanding of the audience and the documentation required by meeting with senior DevOps and Product team members to discuss technical problems
  • Researches and builds knowledge about products, services, technology, or concepts to be documented
  • Determines the clearest and most logical way to present information and instructions for greatest reader comprehension and writes and edits technical information accordingly
  • Revises, edits, or updates instructions, technical information, and frequently asked questions as necessary
  • Creates all required technical documentation such that constituent products and services can be outsourced.
  • Creates standardised specification templates to ensure consistency of product catalogue and documentation

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • 3 years of experience in technical writing
  • Experience working on SaaS products
  • Experience of working on internet systems involving APIs and Web apps
  • Familiarity with version control systems (Git)
  • Understanding of and ability to document REST interfaces
  • Understanding of and ability to document API products
  • Excellent time and project management experience

About Croud

Croud is turning the world of digital marking on its head thanks to a unique combination of a globally distributed network of on-demand domain experts and a suite of ground breaking automation solutions.

As a result we are able to offer our clients a range of highly cost effective and best in class digital marketing solutions across a range of services including  PPC, SEO, Content, Display and Paid Social. We sincerely believe we are the best agency in the world and that employing the very best people is essential to ensure that we remain in that position.

We’re looking for an exceptional PHP developer to help us build out our suite of tools and services that help us deliver the best service to our customers.

Benefits

25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Annual performance bonus
Sale commission and candidate referral bonus
Pension scheme
Gym membership contributions
Ride to Work scheme
Free fruit, breakfast cereals and tea & coffee
Childcare Voucher Scheme
Share options following six months of employment
Enhanced Maternity / Paternity package

items.title: Features music writers
items.content:
*About GigList*

GigList is a market-disruptive music events and magazine site that launched in April 2017. Powered by an ambitious and successful team, we’re pushing the boundaries of what music media and event listings can achieve.

*About the role*

GigList is looking for full time, features writers to work on interesting editorial features and artist interviews. The candidate will be required to submit editorial and features ideas, or pick up on ones already in our content calendar. Focussing largely on industry topics, music reviews, artist profiles and interviews.

*About you*

The role is a remote one and can be based anywhere in the country. You will be a self-motivated person, who is passionate about music, with great organisation skills, and excellent writing abilities. This role will likely develop into a sub-editor role within 12 months, so is ideal for those with some experience already, who are looking to launch their careers in music journalism.

*How to apply*

Send us your CV and writing samples and we will be in touch soon to arrange an interview.

items.title: Technical Writer- Rest API - Remote job
items.content:
Technical Writer- Rest API - Remote job - Jobmote

Technical Writer- Rest API - Remote job

Infinitum Global LLC

Position Title: Technical Writer - (only W2 profiles)

Location : REMOTE POSITION

Duration : 12Months W2 Contract Position

Job Description:

Looking for contractor-technical writer type resource whom we can leverage for developing the Clear Commerce partner integration document for Restful API.

Domain experience: Looking for commerce, credit cards, finance, banking domain experience.

Responsibilities

Work with internal teams to obtain an in-depth understanding of the product and the documentation requirements

Produce high-quality documentation that meets applicable standards and is appropriate for its intended audience

Write easy-to-understand user interface text, online help and developer guides

Create tutorials to help end-users use a variety of applications

Analyze existing and potential content, focusing on reuse and single-sourcing opportunities

Create and maintain the information architecture

Requirements

Proven working experience in technical writing of software documentation

Ability to deliver high quality documentation paying attention to detail

Ability to quickly grasp complex technical concepts and make them easily understandable in text and pictures

Excellent written skills in English

Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office

Basic familiarity with the SDLC and software development

University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent preferred

  • provided by Dice Technical writer, Restful API

items.title: Cisco Unified Communications Engineer (Remote)
items.content:
Cisco Unified Communications Engineer (Remote) - Jobmote

Cisco Unified Communications Engineer (Remote)

Valor Global

Members of the Valor Solutions team implement technical solutions as developed by Solutions Architects for Valor s customers.

This position will be responsible for the following:

  • Manage both service requests and trouble tickets related to the Cisco UCCE environment within predefined SLA s
  • Create documentation for customers and keep documentation up to date with an attention to detail and natural desire to be thorough
  • Responsible for resolving technical escalations from the Service Desk staff
  • Participate in on call rotation

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Add, Delete User
  • Add, change or delete a hard/IP Soft phone
  • Deploy or recover physical device
  • Adding IP Phone Service Subscriptions
  • Modifying or Adding a hunt group appearance
  • Reset Voice Mailbox
  • Change a Parameter (Name, Department or User ID) Number within the CMDB
  • Assign Line to Existing Phone
  • Add a Voicemail box to an existing phone
  • Add, change, move or delete station features
  • Assign or Modify Class of Service to an existing phone
  • Adding or Deleting Software Extensions
  • Change Name of a Voice Mailbox to a new user
  • Create or Delete Speed Call/Dial Lists
  • Create ACD Login ID
  • Station Call Redirection
  • Create or Delete Distribution Lists.
  • ACD Group Creation or Deletion
  • External VM Network Changes
  • Menu Tree modification
  • TOD Changes
  • Add, change, move or delete all extension assignments
  • Create, modify or delete traffic patterns
  • Manage port utilization
  • Add, change, or delete a Class of Service
  • Add, change, or delete a Class of Restrictions
  • Add, Change or remove a member in a trunk group

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

  • High School Diploma or GED
  • BA/BS in Information Technology or Technology related degree (preferred)
  • Minimum five (2+) years of experience working in technical support role
  • Cisco, Juniper, or other VoIP or network certifications desirable

CERTIFICATIONS

A current CCNA Voice/Collaboration Certification or CCNP Voice/Collaboration Certification would be desirable

  • provided by Dice Cisco, Juniper, VoIP

items.title: Lean Startup Co.: Community Concierge
items.content:
Community Concierge

Posted Apr 17

Lean Startup Co.
Headquarters: Anywhere
https://lean-startup-co.breezy.hr/p/1198ed23b8f701-community-concierge?source=weworkremotely
View all Lean Startup Co. jobs →

ABOUT US:
Born from the global movement spawned by bestselling-author Eric Ries, Lean Startup Company offers the most exciting education solutions in modern management available today.

We help advance Lean Startup principles, which provide a cutting edge, scientific framework for innovation so organizations of all sizes can effectively adapt and adjust before it’s too late.

Our year-round efforts transform how organizations work by arming them with an entrepreneurial methodology. We serve every size company and sector of the economy — from the the aspiring entrepreneur to high-growth startups, nonprofits, and large bureaucratic institutions. They look to us for practical lessons in modern management. We serve our highly-engaged community with professional, practical content and live events and by connecting leaders with experts who can coach them in Lean Startup.

ABOUT THE POSITION
We’re seeking a community-driven customer concierge to be the conduit between our global network and our remote Lean Startup Co. team. This is a full time, remote administrative role for a self-starter with excellent organizational skills who loves helping customers resolve questions in a timely manner. You’re the vital first step in connecting our avid community members with our community experts, educators, events, and resources.

Concierge Responsibilities

  • Field all calls to our general company phone line and email. Respond to all inquiries/correspondences within 24 business hours.
  • Assess the needs of incoming inquiries to understand the individual’s needs. Be their advocate to get them to the right solution.
  • Based on knowledge of solutions across the Lean Startup ethos, connect the community member with the person(s) applicable to their needs. For example, conference team, ambassador program, Lean Impact, volunteer opportunities, or other allies in our community.
  • Log and categorize all inquiries, including the sources and themes of the questions, as well as the outcomes.
  • Make the experience high-touch and well organized; the community member should feel satisfied with his/her needs being met.
  • Develop FAQs and directory/escalation flows based on common inquiries.
  • Be flexible and adaptable to new LSCo team needs as they arise; you’re the all-important administrative support for our events, sales, education teams, and community efforts.

Administrative Support Responsibilities

  • Support the Education team with:
  • Call/meeting preparation
  • Creation of decks, proposals and agreements
  • Calendaring support for calls and meetings
  • Use tools like Salesloft
  • And other responsibilities as needs and opportunities arise
  • Support business development team with Salesforce data entry and regular maintenance/audits as well as Google Drive organization
  • Manage and create ad hoc Salesforce report requests
  • Other support requests as needed.


    • You’ll fit right into our team if:

    • You pride yourself on being extremely detail oriented and have excellent communication skills. You proof anything you write multiple times before hitting “send.”
    • You’ve mastered the art of phone and email communication when it comes to understanding how to treat each person with the utmost respect and care.
    • You’re personable and empathetic. You’re able to quickly connect with people, gain their trust, and guide them in the right direction.
    • You’re an excellent troubleshooter, able to spot and figure out the solutions for an array of issues with minimal guidance from others. You take pride in problem-solving.
    • You have experience with, and genuinely enjoy working for a young, growing startup.
    • You have a strong sense of ownership and urgency as it relates to the health of the company.
    • You possess high levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.
    • You are open to feedback, take ownership of your mistakes, and love applying your lessons learned to get 10x better.
    • You have a keen ability to manage competing and changing priorities.
    • You work well with cross-functional teams and hold yourself accountable for your actions.

    Requirements

    • College degree
    • 2+ yrs experience in sales support and/or similar role (office manager/administrative assistant/customer liaison). Must have demonstrated experience representing a company in a professional, friendly manner.
    • Experience with Salesforce.
    • Comfort working with a remote team and using the tools such work requires (Slack, Zoom, Google apps)

    Bonus if you have:

    • Experience selling or supporting a sales team selling consulting services.
    • Business development experience in Lean Startup, tech and/or enterprise innovation spaces.

    Why You’ll Love Working With Us

    • We encourage growth.
    • If it’s your dream to become a leader in an organization, this is the role for you. We seek entrepreneurial types who want to be promoted and grow with us.
  • You can work from the location of your choice as long as you have a working laptop and solid internet connection.
    • We’re a 100% remote team that incorporates quarterly team onsites to ensure we have face time (fun team bonding activities included!)
    • We encourage unplugging for vacation and prefer you don’t check email while you’re away.
  • You’ll have a big impact.
    • If you’ve ever wanted to be in the middle of massive business transformations, this is the role for you. The work we do is powerfully transformative.
    • We are a startup with global brand recognition headquartered in San Francisco, CA. Our global community will give you a front row seat to the innovation challenges they’re facing. Better yet, you’ll get to help them solve those problems.

    *Note: Once you’ve applied for the job, we understand that you’ll be eager to hear back from us. Due to the high volume of applicants, we can’t respond individually regarding your specific application.Please do not reach out to us regarding your application. If there is a mutual fit, we will contact you to move forward with the next steps in the process.

    Apply for this position

    https://lean-startup-co.breezy.hr/p/1198ed23b8f701-community-concierge?source=weworkremotely

items.title: Replay Gaming Limited: Community Coordinator
items.content:
Community Coordinator

Posted Apr 6

Replay Gaming Limited
Headquarters: London
www.replaypoker.com
View all Replay Gaming Limited jobs →

The role

We’re looking for a Community Coordinator to join our small, fully-distributed Operations team on a Tuesday through Saturday schedule. This is a remote, full-time position available to candidates based anywhere in the US or UK.

As a Community Coordinator, you’ll be connecting with our player base daily. You’ll help us cover our ticket queues, assisting players with technical issues, rules questions, abuse reports, payment disputes, and any other questions they may have. You’ll be their advocate, passing along suggestions and feedback to management to help shape our development plan.

You’ll be one person on a Community team of three people passionate about providing the best poker experience for our players. This means you’ll have the chance to be innovative and own exciting projects, from assisting with volunteer management, blog publishing, creating social media content, and more! You’re someone who thinks creatively and can move a project forward without micromanagement.

Our team makes heavy use of Slack, ZenDesk, Confluence, Asana, Intercom, Discourse, WordPress, Disqus, and various social media channels. While you don’t need to be an expert with any of this software, we are looking for someone technically-savvy enough to pick things up quickly.

About us

  • We’re a growing team, so you’ll have a huge impact on the decisions and work being done.

  • Our company is spread out across Europe, North America, South America and Asia.

  • We currently have a small London office (WeWork South Bank Central) where the CEO and COO are based, while everyone else works remotely, 100% of the time. If you're close to London, then you'll have the option to use our London office whenever you prefer.

Qualifications and skills

  • 2+ years of customer support experience.

  • Remote work experience.

  • Technical aptitude. You should know how to clear a cache, take a screenshot, make a gif, and send a tweet.

  • Familiarity with help desk software, social media, and online forums.

  • Outstanding English language skills and the ability to communicate complicated subjects in a simple, readable way.

  • Tuesday - Saturday availability, with the ability to attend meetings from 11am - 1pm Eastern Time.

  • Empathy, patience, positivity, and enthusiasm for teamwork. We value soft skills here!

Ideal candidates will also have …

  • A love of poker, or the desire to learn!

  • Social media and/or blog management experience.

  • A background of forum participation or moderation.

  • Payments, disputes, and fraud experience.

  • Volunteer management experience.

  • A history of creating measurable goals and owning metrics.

  • Experience with mobile and/or freemium games.

Apply for this position

Send a resume to ash@replaypoker.com

items.title: LitCharts: Freelance Writer
items.content:
Freelance Writer

Posted Apr 4

LitCharts
Headquarters: New York
www.litcharts.com
View all LitCharts jobs →

LitCharts writers are an exclusive group of excellent writers with a deep understanding of literature and how to teach it to others. LitCharts writers have gone on to become best-selling nonfiction writers, 2017 national book award finalists, New York Times journalists, Harvard literature PhD candidates, and more. Now you can apply to join them!

We're hiring writers to help expand our collection of over 500 literature guides. Writers can work from anywhere and compensation varies based on the length and difficulty of the work. Pace and schedule are flexible, though our ideal candidates will have at least 10 hours per week to spend writing LitCharts.


Apply for this position

Please send a resume as well as two writing samples to writing@litcharts.com. Samples should be academic papers that demonstrate your ability to analyze literature with insight and clarity. Samples should be at least 5 pages long, and can be up to any length (a thesis would be fine, for instance). We will not consider applications that do not include academic papers focused on literature.

items.title: Audience Ops: Blog Writer for Ongoing Retainer (Topics: WordPress / Design / Dev / Business / Marketing)
items.content:
Blog Writer for Ongoing Retainer (Topics: WordPress / Design / Dev / Business / Marketing)

Posted Apr 3

Audience Ops
Headquarters: US
https://audienceops.com/jobs/writer/?src=weworkremotely
View all Audience Ops jobs →

Write your very best stuff at Audience Ops!

We're currently seeking a writer who has experience working with (and writing about) any of the following subjects:

  • WordPress
  • Web design
  • Web development
  • User Experience
  • Software development
  • Business
  • Online marketing

That said — the most important quality we’re looking for is your ability to write for industries that are relatively unfamiliar to you. You love asking questions and turning research interviews into compelling articles. You’ll be able to build your knowledge as you write for niche clients over a long period of time.

About working at Audience Ops:

We give you steady writing work, a proven team-driven process that allows you to research each audience, come up with topics that matter, and we’ll support you so you can produce stuff that will resonate and genuinely help those readers get ahead.
Here’s why our writers love being part of the Audience Ops team:

  • Steady, longterm, reliable freelance retainer.
  • You get to brainstorm and research your own topics to write about.
  • Our editors and other teammates are here to support you.
  • Work from anywhere, any hours (we just care that your weekly deadlines are met)
  • The best team Slack chat on the Internet

Requirements:

  • Must be based in the United States
  • You’re comfortable working remotely
  • You have steady, ongoing part-time availability.
  • You've written blog content professionally and have samples of your work to share.

Apply for this position

Submit your application here: https://audienceops.com/jobs/writer/?src=weworkremotely

items.title: AgentFire.com: Chief Content Officer! - Pro Video/Blog Creator w/ Community Building Exp. for Real Estate Industry
items.content:
Chief Content Officer! - Pro Video/Blog Creator w/ Community Building Exp. for Real Estate Industry

Posted Mar 27

AgentFire.com
Headquarters: Online
AgentFire.com
View all AgentFire.com jobs →

Hi Guys, 

It's time for AgentFire to get very serious about it's content marketing. Our self-published content ranks tremendously well thanks to thousands of quality backlinks established over the last 5 or so years. We're looking on someone who can help us truly capitalize on that with engaging, well-planned written and video content for our client base and broader audience. 

We build real estate websites for real estate agents and brokers in the USA and Canada - For an example of a company creating killer content within our space you can check here: https://placester.com/real-estate-marketing-academy/

In summary we're looking for someone
  • Content Writing: Someone that can write concise, highly engaging content predicated around an intimate knowledge of both our product and our consumer base. Our stuff ranks really well so there should be a focus on creating very targeted content designed to rank well for various long tail keywords. 
  • Video: Can stand in front of a white (or otherwise neutral) background to record videos (we have animators and people that will do all of the edits, for an example video check here: https://placester.com/real-estate-marketing-academy/ - so you would plan out your content, film in front of a whiteboard and do basic editing - we have animators that would add in our characters / animations based on your oversight 
  • Community Building: Someone with an extremely friendly / infectious type personality that can help us build out the 'community' aspect of our business. We have tons of really happy clients (https://www.facebook.com/pg/AgentFireSites/reviews/) and we want to build content that supports them and helps them to engage more with us and with each other!
  • Bonus: Experience w/ Facebook and/or Google Marketing: The most compelling content for our industry centers around Facebook and Google Marketing strategies (really anything that helps real estate agents generate more leads and close more deals) - so experience here is a big plus!

Hours
You can work pretty much whenever you want - generally speaking our hours are from 9am to 9pm EST - and we are definitely looking for someone that can work fulltime (40hrs +)

Compensation
Pay will be commensurate with experience and what you bring to the table! Starting at $15/hr-$20/hr (and possibly higher for a real killer)

Location
This is a work from home position (why else would I post on weworkremotely.com! hehe) however if you've ever fancied the idea of living abroad in a place like Medellin, Colombia (which is where I'm personally based and have a small office) - that door is open and major bonus points as I've got recording stuff / film crew setup here!

Apply for this position

If you think you'd be a good fit for the position, please send your application with as much information as possible (i.e. content or videos you've created) to nelson@agentfire.com!

items.title: Eating Europe: Content & Social Media Specialist
items.content:
Content & Social Media Specialist

Posted Mar 22

Eating Europe
Headquarters: Europe
https://eating-europe-tours.workable.com/jobs/687728
View all Eating Europe jobs →

Please note: We are seeking candidates in the following time-zone only: Europe (GMT+0 - GMT+4) - essentially between Ireland and Eastern Europe.

Eating Europe is dedicated to making trips unforgettably delicious by taking guests on unique tours which combine history, culture, and the absolute best food available in that city.

We are offering a full-time (40 hours/week) remote position for candidates located within European time zones.

Reporting to the Content Marketing Strategist and Head of Marketing, you will also work closely with the wider Marketing team, especially PR, and food tour managers in different countries across Europe.

The ideal candidate has a Marketing background, with proven organizational and analytical abilities and excellent communication skills, particularly written.

This is an amazing opportunity for an ambitious, talented individual who is looking to grow as part of a remote team.
Although this role will require a creative mind, a considerable amount of time will be spent on planning and organising content.

REQUIREMENTS

As the Content & Social Media Specialist you will:

Maintain and update our editorial publishing calendar. Work closely with other members of the Marketing team to make sure our publishing schedule mirrors our campaign efforts.
Research, write and schedule content (WordPress, social media posts, emails). A/B testing and reporting. You’ll need to have an intuitive understanding of what makes for outstanding online content.

Track campaigns across social media, email and our website. Report on campaign results.

Upload Marketing files (documents, images, spreadsheets, etc.) on the shared drive, generally ensure files are kept well organized.

Monitor industry trends and generate creative ideas for Marketing campaigns. You’ll need to be confident reaching out to social media influencers to develop positive, ongoing relationships with them.

Work with designers to create visual assets for our site and Marketing. Work and manage content creation with writers, influencers, photographers, video producers etc.
We want to hear from you if you have:
- At least 2-4 years’ experience in a similar role
- A Native English speaker
- Impeccable grammar, writing, organizational and time management skills
- Excellent interpersonal skills and attention to detail
- Solid knowledge of Inbound Marketing principles
- Experience in developing amazing online content
- Used WordPress and know SEO best practices
- Experience with scheduling platforms such as Hootsuite, Tweetdeck, etc.
- Basic photo-editing skills
- Can think critically and problem-solve in an entrepreneurial environment
It's a bonus if you have any of the following:

- Previous experience working freelance/remotely
- A passion for food, travel and European culture
- Knowledge of E-Mail Marketing Platforms (i.e. Mailchimp, Drip, ActiveCampaign)
- Experience with remote tools like Slack & Trello
- Basic HTML knowledge
- Basic video editing skills
- You speak other languages
BENEFITS
Competitive. The range is based on market research and is equitable to other roles within Eating Europe. The actual compensation offered to the chosen candidate is chosen on relative experience and skills.

Apply for this position

Please apply here: https://eating-europe-tours.workable.com/jobs/687728

items.title: Technical Writer @ Flux7
items.content:
Technical Writer @ Flux7

2018-03-22 00:52

Description
  • Are you an experienced Technical Writer who wants to work remotely and collaborate with a great engineering team?
  • Do you have a natural talent for speaking clearly about ideas others may find complex?
  • Do you have a passion for technology and learning and a desire to work with an award-winning AWS Premier Consulting Firm?

If so, we want to hear from you!

Flux7 is one of Austin’s fastest growing companies. We are a DevOps-based IT consultancy that provides architecture and migration solutions to enable companies to independently manage their own cloud infrastructure. We have an immediate opening for a Technical Writer who will analyze, compile and translate complex Flux7 material, such as technical specifications, notes, and drawings, into easily understandable user manuals, guides, and other documents that clearly and concisely explain the installation, operation, and maintenance of software and other technical components.

We believe in our Core Values of Innovation, Humility, and Transparency, and we treat each other with respect and empathy.

What you will be doing:

  • Planning, developing, organizing, authoring, and editing operational procedures, manuals, and user guides;
  • Collaborating with other departments to collect technical specifications and to understand customer requirements, in order to target materials to the end user;
  • Delivering quality, consistent and precise documentation based on Flux7 standards;

What you will need to be successful in this role:

  • A University degree in English, Journalism, Computer Science, Engineering or other related fields;
  • A minimum of 2 years proven experience as a technical writer;
  • A proven commitment to continuous improvement, learning, and growth;
  • Superior demonstrated writing skills, with an ability to construct clear, concise, and simple sentences to aid in communication;
  • Demonstrated experience interacting and collaborating with Subject-Matter Experts (SME’s) to extract and translate complex and technical information.
  • A strong ability to synthesize and organize data to create a natural order of information that allows the end user to easily understand concepts and carry out system requirements.
  • An ability to mentor engineers in improving their ability to create documentation and presentations;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly and concisely explain complex information;
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail;
  • Strong initiative and an ability to work productively within a fully remote team.

Great to have:

  • Basic understanding of Agile methodology;
  • Hands-on experience with AWS platform, GIT, and related technologies - you know what ec2 and cloud are, right?
  • Experience in writing technical documents that support the work of developers and cloud architects.

What we offer:

  • Salary Range: $60K - $65K annually (depending on experience level);
  • Health benefits plan;
  • A great team of helpful, kind, motivated, and talented people to work with;
  • 100% Remote work so you have no commute and are free to travel and work from where you want;
  • Flexible work hours- so you are free to plan the day how you like and better manage your personal life;
  • Continued education and certification opportunities
  • Focused on results, not on long hours, so that you can have a life; we actually require you to have fun and some relaxation time!

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Communications Assistant
items.content:
Sourcefabric shares technology and experience worldwide to help create quality, independent journalism. We make and implement solutions based on open source software.
We are seeking a full-time assistant to join our marketing communications team.

You will be dealing with
* Production of digital content related to Sourcefabric and our products
* Run social media channels
* Help produce and distribute newsletters
* Proofread deliverables in print and online
* Research and stay up to date with the industry news and market developments
* Help produce press releases, product descriptions and case studies and other communications material
* Assist in video content production

Preferred skills and experience
* Experience with publications in various media
* Previous experience in marketing communications is a plus
* Excellent writing and editing skills
* Native English speaker or nearly native knowledge

Bonus experience and skills
* Experience with Mailchimp
* Illustrator, Photoshop, Adobe Creative Suite

(Some of) the perks…
* An international environment: Find yourself surrounded by talented team members from across the globe (more than 14 countries).
* Flexible work arrangements.

How to apply
* Send your CV (no more than two pages) and a cover letter (including your salary expectations).
* Interviews will take place in March - early April with the starting date ASAP.

items.title: Help Scout: Content Strategist
items.content:
Content Strategist

Posted Mar 20

Help Scout
Headquarters: remote
www.helpscout.com/careers
View all Help Scout jobs →

Your impact

We’ve always believed and invested in content marketing at Help Scout, and it’s proved to be the driving force behind our growth. 

More than 300k unique monthly visitors read our blog, our education platform, and our resources. As a Content Strategist, you’ll have a huge part in helping us reach our next goal of one million monthly sessions, and work with the marketing and sales teams to guide those visitors down the funnel.

By creating and promoting content of all kinds, you’ll play a key role in helping us get our message out, raise awareness and build our brand. 

About the role:
  • You’ll develop and execute content campaigns with members of our Support, Sales, Marketing, and Product teams, as well as external partners.
  • You’ll plan and manage all social initiatives including Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin, Instagram, and our newsletter. 
  • Whether it’s video, webinars, reports or new templates, you’ll collaborate with the team members to define what types of content to create and how to measure their impact. 
  • You’ll produce content that meets our high standards of excellence and creates the utmost value for readers.
  • We have a loyal audience and always need fresh ideas. You’ll bring new, engaging ideas to our content that delight our current base and help engage new audience members.

About You:
  • You have worked in SaaS and enjoy the challenges of attracting people and getting them to consider our product. You’ve been a part of the content process before, developing different kinds of content (webinars, guides) and understand how they fit into the buying process.  
  • You are an exceptional writer, with the ability to grasp complex ideas and explain them in plain language. You work hard to make every word matter. Your style is friendly and engaging, and contains just the right amount of humor.
  • Being detail-oriented isn’t just a sound bite for you; it’s one of your strongest qualities. This job requires superhuman organization and communication skills.
  • You have a good understanding of what it takes for a business to succeed and grow through a variety of content marketing channels, yet you continue to experiment and learn new things.
  • You are empathetic and thoughtful, always putting yourself in the customer’s shoes. You know that the most relevant messages start with understanding how people feel.
  • You believe remote teams are the future of work. You have experience working with remote teams and can adjust your work style to be remote-friendly.

Who you’ll work with:
John Short, VP Marketing — John leads the Marketing team and is pumped when good marketing leads to a meaningful customer experience This role reports to him.
Emily Triplett Lentz, Blog Editor and Content Strategist — Emily is a content marketer with a strong background in journalism and customer support. She runs the blog and other content initiatives. You’ll collaborate with Emily on strategy and execution. 
Mat Patterson, Customer Evangelist — Mat is the magic behind HelpU, our customer support education platform. Before joining Help Scout, he ran the support team at Campaign Monitor for nine years. He keeps our target customers engaged and always learning more.  

Benefits
  • Competitive Salary - We pay at or above market salary in most cases and evaluate a lot of research to make sure everyone is paid well. The formula we use to calculate all salaries is public to employees and is improved upon regularly.
  • Work anywhere - Work from our office in Boston or anywhere else, provided you have 4 hours of overlap with the team. We’ll even buy your home office furniture or help you pay for a co-working space.
  • Health and dental insurance - We cover you and your family's health/dental insurance 100%. If you are based in the US, we'll cover you on our Aetna policy.
  • Long-term/Short-term Disability Insurance & Life Insurance - we cover 100% of the premiums for LT/ST Disability insurance and base Life Insurance. You also have the option to purchase supplementary life insurance through our provider.
  • International Benefit Stipend - If you’re based outside the US, you’ll receive a monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, long and short-term disability, and accountant costs.
  • Flexible vacation - Take time off when you need it, we trust you.
  • Paid parental leave, including adoption - 12 weeks if you have or adopt a baby, 4 weeks if your partner has a baby.
  • 401k with 1% match- 1% Retirement Plan matching for both US and International Employees
  • Personal development stipend - Up to $1,800 per year to improve your craft
  • Great tools - Each employee receives a Mac laptop and 27'' display (or equivalent). We’ll also purchase any of the software or hardware you need as well as high-end furniture to get your home office started
  • Complete transparency - Everyone has full access to business metrics and financial information about the company.

About us

Help Scout is made by roughly 70 people in 40+ cities around the world, all with a passion for excellence in their craft.

We come from diverse backgrounds and are united by an enthusiasm for great products and delightful customer experiences.

Since launching in April of 2011, Help Scout now powers 8,000+ support teams in over 140 countries. Our software is used and trusted by businesses of every shape and size.

Designed to go the distance

Our mission is to foster the world’s customer-centric businesses by providing tools that serve customers in the most human, helpful way. While growth is important, team and values are paramount. We’re always striving to do impactful work we’re proud of in lieu of chasing overnight success.

We’re builders without borders

Our entire team is free to work remotely from wherever they choose. We overcome remote challenges through transparency, trust, and video conferencing. The reward is worth the effort—we’ll take talent, skill, and diverse perspectives over local geography any day.

Above all, we want Help Scout to be a place where passionate people can do their very best work. You won’t find any ping-pong tables or kegerators here. Instead, you’ll be surrounded by driven, supportive teammates who will push you to be better. We take work/life harmony seriously, too, as we want every career at Help Scout to be a long and satisfying one.

Diversity & Inclusion
We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to building a company that embraces and celebrates diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for this position

https://jobs.lever.co/helpscout/400bc5b6-199a-4ddf-91a3-0c05573ad880

items.title: Senior Applications Architect (Content Applications) at Daily Kos (Kos Media LLC) (Oakland, CA)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Digital Media
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Location: Remote within the US or Oakland, CA

We are seeking an Applications Architect who will lead a small team of developers to evolve the Content Applications (publishing, authoring, commenting, image library) from primarily a monolithic Rails application to a services-oriented architecture. This person will work closely with the System Architect of the Services team to realize the organization's goals.

Daily Kos is a great place to work-- your code will be used by hundreds of thousands of people a day who care deeply about progressive politics and are working to effect real political change. We provide an extensive feature set that extends from blogging to activism and beyond. If you want a job that offers more than just a technical challenge, we'd love to hear from you. Our organization’s commitment to personal growth reduces churn and encourages a rewarding long-term position. We have an energized team filled with great people with different backgrounds.

Qualifications:

  • We are seeking an independent, remote-work experienced technical leader who:
  • can weigh tradeoffs of different application design decisions given requirements with team and organizational risk in mind and articulate this to Product Management to help them make informed choices (also have an appreciation for system architecture);
  • can articulate the difference between CRUD-based and Event-based system architectures and their relative tradeoffs;
  • has recent experience with growing the skills of a small development team as a mentor or people manager (must be interested in managing 3-6 developers);
  • has on-call experience for applications they have delivered to production;
  • has production experience maintaining, and evolving a Rails "majestic" monolith into a service-oriented design.

The above list is a set of highly desired attributes; we will evaluate each candidate as a whole. Tell us about unique skills, experiences, and attributes that you can bring to such a role that we may be missing and why it would be a benefit to the organization.

About Daily Kos (Kos Media LLC)

Daily Kos is the nation's largest liberal online political community, news organization, and activism hub. Powered by millions of dedicated activists, we’re transforming media and organizing by empowering regular Americans to reshape politics.

Daily Kos offers competitive salary, excellent benefits including generous time off along with paid maternity/paternity/family leave, employer ­paid medical insurance for employees, and a flexible work environment. You need to pick up your kids from school? No problem. You like to work out in the middle of the day? No problem. The office is conveniently located in Oakland, CA, close to BART. People love working here, and tend to stay for a long time. We have a great space filled with great people, and the atmosphere is energized by the day's news events and our common cause.

At Daily Kos, we believe that the diversity of ideas, experiences, and cultures that our employees contribute to our organization help us be more effective activists, and we are proud to be an inclusive and equal­ opportunity workplace. We're a company that loves learning and supports growth and training for all our employees. This position will be located remotely or in our Oakland, CA office.

Benefits

100% Medical Coverage
6 weeks paid vacation per year
401K Plan

items.title: Principal Technical Writer @ Sensu
items.content:
Principal Technical Writer @ Sensu

2018-03-15 13:10

Description
About Sensu

Sensu is a well-funded young startup experiencing exponential growth thanks to strong market differentiation in the application and infrastructure monitoring space.

About the Position

Sensu is looking for a talented, tech-savvy writer to join our Customer Success team. As a Principal Technical Writer, your focus will be on the leading a thoughtful taxonomy of documentation across our products with an emphasis on reducing the friction of new participants becoming regular contributors within our guidelines. You will have the time and budget to experiment on ways to improve our documentation. You will also have teammates who know the product (Success Engineers and Developer Advocate), manage our content (Marketing Content Strategist) and write new feature documentation (Engineering) so you have room to do what you do best.

Responsibilities
  • Teach others to write great documentation. Shepherd everything from product features coming out of our engineering team to new community contributors looking to fix that command-line argument they found inaccurate.
  • Champion a taxonomy that works for new and advanced users alike. Design a system, within the technical limitations of our tooling, that makes sense now and for the future.
  • Drive documentation as a product, being accountable for not only its content but also its roadmap, presentation, navigation, analytics and SEO alongside peers focused on Marketing Analytics. Lead in the definition of needed guides and any education to communicate your craft.
  • Design practices that lead to a consistent use of Sensu’s tone, which is defined as “community-driven, informed, informal.”
  • Continually improve documentation through direct feedback-gathering and experimentation.
About You

Our ideal candidate will meet the required experience and most of the following qualifications:

  • [Required] Expertise in Open Source documentation. GitHub knowledge is a must. Serious git-fu is welcome, but not required. You can point to experiences writing documentation, style guides, or similar work for an audience related to ours (SREs, DevOps engineers, system administrators or developers).
  • Experience wrangling web technologies in order to build beautiful documentation (HTML, CSS and JavaScript in particular). Familiarity with the nuances of Hugo will be helpful.
  • Past success as a Technical Writer is an advantage. That said, a diverse skill set as shown by your past roles and open source contributions is more important. Experience in Testing/QA, Customer Success, Product Management or Marketing is a plus.
  • You enjoy writing about technical products, including server software and REST APIs, and easily translate technical concepts into content accessible to the uninitiated.
  • Willing to occasionally travel in order to conduct user and subject matter expert interviews.
  • Excellent spoken and written English.
  • Committed to work in accordance with our Code of Conduct.
Benefits
  • Competitive and transparent salary, $120,000 per year.
  • Equity! Every member of Team Sensu receives equity in Sensu, Inc. (in the form of common stock options).
  • Work from anywhere in the United States or Canada! We are a distributed team with flexible working hours and no central office location.
  • 4-week minimum vacation policy, only used for full days off (20 days of PTO per year). Employees with unused vacation at the end of the year will have their access to company resources disabled until the new year (e.g. email, Slack, GitHub, etc), corresponding to their balance of unused PTO! If you manage to exhaust your PTO, additional PTO will be granted depending on impact to team objectives.
  • Company paid holidays, based on the US Federal holiday schedule of 10 days per year (may be exchanged for alternate dates, e.g. personal days).
  • Company provided health care for employees located in the United States (includes medical, dental, and vision coverage). Company pays 100% of premiums for employee, spouse, and dependent children.
  • Company paid disability insurance (overlapping short-term and long-term coverage).
  • Company paid life insurance policy, $100K guaranteed (no medical exam required).
  • Monthly phone & internet allowance ($150/mo).
  • Equipment allowance! We provide a $5,000 allowance for new employees, with a $1000 refresh every 12-months, and a $4,000 every 18 months for updating your laptop and other equipment.
Professional Development Opportunities

At Sensu, professional development is not only encouraged – it is expected. Individual career growth opportunities abound. Looking to level up some technical ability, advance your leadership skills, or continue some education? Whether you're beginning your career or mastering your craft, Sensu will help you get to the next level of you.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Sensu does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law (or human decency) in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

Furthermore, we believe that homogeneous teams are not only boring, but also disadvantaged due to a lack of diversity (of vantage points, etc). We foster a welcoming environment for everyone and we would love for you to be part of it.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Work from anywhere in the United States or Canada!

items.title: Open Source & Community Liaison @ Laravel
items.content:
Open Source & Community Liaison @ Laravel

2018-03-09 19:13

Description

Laravel is Hiring Again

Laravel is hiring again. I hired Mohamed, Laravel’s first employee, over a year ago. Mohamed has done a fantastic job improving many aspects of the Laravel ecosystem. However, I think Laravel could benefit from a third employee.

While I focus on general ecosystem direction and core framework features, Mohamed will primarily focus on development and maintenance on Laravel’s commercial offerings. So, I believe Laravel could benefit from someone dedicated to assisting with the open-source portion of the ecosystem.

Title: Open Source & Community Liaison

Responsibilities: Manage GitHub issues across all of Laravel’s open-source repositories, as well as the “laravel/internals” repository. Issue reports will need to be either closed, triaged as something that requires my attention, or fixed.

Ideally, you will be able to fix general bugs in the framework that are reported through GitHub, so a thorough knowledge of Laravel is preferred. For larger issues that arise, bug fixing will be a team effort between you, Mohamed, and myself.

In addition to bug fixing and issue management, you may sometimes experiment with prototyping new features for the framework.

Finally, you are encouraged to stick around various Laravel community channels such as the Laracasts forums, LaraChat Slack, and Laravel.io. This will help us identify common problems Laravel developers are having and improve the overall developer experience of the framework.

Remote developers from around the world are encouraged to apply!

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Dystribute: Freelance Writers - Social Media Content Creators Only
items.content:
Freelance Writers - Social Media Content Creators Only

Posted Mar 7

Dystribute
Headquarters: Remote

View all Dystribute jobs →

Dystribute is a new writing platform that will rely on 100%paid social marketing to promote articles and compensate writers for theiroriginal content via a revenue share with the platform. We are looking for thefollowing criteria in our writers to become our beta testers:

- Solid writing experience especially insocial/shareable media – published links will be requested  
- 1-5 years of writing experience in variousfull-time and freelance positions 
- Writing on topics within pop culture and entertainment is a must 
- Understanding of social media marketing andcontent promotion 
- Being a native English speaker is a must
- Willingness to be beta testers and partners forthe platform 
- Ability to dedicate 5-7 hours per week writingon a freelance basis and 1-2 hours a month for feedback sessions

There will be a revenue share in place for articlespublished. Beta writers will be compensated with a fixed fee in addition tothis for their feedback and being early partners.

To apply: Please send resume and writing links (at least 3-4) to apply@dystribute.com

Apply for this position

Please send resume and writing links (at least 3-4) to apply@dystribute.com

items.title: Music writers and contributors
items.content:
GigList is a market-disruptive music events and magazine site that launched in April 2017. We’re pushing the boundaries of what music media and event listings can achieve.

Powered by an ambitious and successful team, we’re looking to add hungry young things who love music and love to write about it to come on board. Getting involved at this stage can put you in the front row when it comes to your future career in music and media.

We’re looking for voluntary writers based anywhere in the country – particularly around London, Manchester, Brighton, Liverpool, Leeds and Glasgow. We're looking for live gig reviews, album reviews and music features.

Ideally you'll be someone who's already started writing for your own blog and keen to broaden your publications and pick up. You'll be hungry to learn and write about music and events, and have ideas on what you can contribute.

There will be access to free gigs, interviews with artists and other cool stuff. If you’re looking to get started in music journalism and media, this is the ideal role for you to gain exposure and hone your craft.

Get in touch with your CV and any samples you have.

items.title: Freedom Formula: Content Hero
items.content:
Content Hero

Posted Mar 2

Freedom Formula
Headquarters: United States
https://freedom-formula.breezy.hr/p/57bece7589c6-content-hero-content-mastery-apprentice?source=weworkremotely
View all Freedom Formula jobs →

How does a cool $5,000 for one quick facebook message sound? Wonderful?

Wonderful.

Read on and I’ll fill you in on how to take MY money and put it in YOUR pocket... while I give you a nice firm handshake.

Hi I’m Evan - Co-Founder here at Freedom Formula. And my partner and I are on a mission to change lives.

But that’s enough about me for now. Let’s talk about you...

Do you want to learn how to turn a simple Youtube channel into a multi-million dollar business, and be able to impact a million lives without ever stepping on camera?

Are you looking to work with a group of rockstars all around the world, toward big scary goals that will actually make a dent in the world?

How would you like a bunch of autonomy and responsibility in a rapidly growing business, and the ability to learn how to run an extremely successful online business from the inside out... From people who have done it repeatedly?

What about a remote workplace that doesn’t get bogged down in corporate BS - whose ONLY focus as a group is getting results toward our crazy ambitious objectives and having fun...

Do you want to strategize, ideating and creating superior content for a skyrocketing Youtube channel, and creating insanely valuable courses that change people’s lives…

Or perhaps…

An insatiable desire to learn this skill and the EXACT formula for what makes successful Youtube videos - which is at the heart of today’s most influential figures and businesses...?

Well good news! We are looking for a badass to help us create superior new content for our rapidly growing business and youtube channel.

Someone that will quickly become the most badass Youtube expert in the world.

We call it Content Hero - and while others might call it something else (like content manager, video developer, youtube content planner)... They’d be wrong.

We need a hero, and are holding out for a hero til the morning light. Nothing else will suffice.

Do you know a few people who you consider rockstars who sound like they would love this?

If you share this job post with them and we end up hiring them we’ll give you a cool $5k just for sharing the post with them.

Easy money, right?

“That’s a lotta coconuts for a measly facebook message.” - You

“Yeah, very well said… You wordsmithing stranger you...!” - Evan

Alright, let’s talk nitty gritty.

WHO ARE WE, YOU ASK?

We run a really fast-growing company called Freedom Formula, where we help people create their first online business, fire their boss, and live the life that they actually want to live.

And we are searching for the next rockstar to add to our tribe.

9-5 is a curse word in our company, and suggesting cubicles will get you tarred and feathered.

We help people travel the world and spend more time with the people that mean most to them. Curious about what we do? Check us out here.

At the end of the day though, we're a small tribe of really smart and talented rockstars who are working together toward a common goal.

But what is that goal..?

To completely transform the way people look at jobs they don’t love and entrepreneurship in America and around the world.

Our entire tribe is remote, so you get to work from anywhere. We are innovating left and right and we do work that changes lives.

We work hard, get shit done and are insanely informal.

Don't believe me? What if we did a perfect lobster walk?


BOOM. 10/10 Crustacean Shuffle.

Anyway... Back to the good stuff.

We deliver an amazing product to help all of our students and are doing an amazing job at marketing and changing people’s lives... which has allowed us to grow really fast.

But, because of all the growth, some of us have gotten way too busy… Which is where you come in… If you want to go fast.

"I wanna go fast"

-Ricky Bobby


THIS IS FOR YOU IF:

  • You have an in-depth knowledge of (or crazy desire to learn) what makes compelling Youtube content, and can outline video content that would help our students for both Youtube and our courses.
  • You can consistently pick out patterns in what is working, what is not, and why
  • You are able to proactively meet and exceed deadlines by working ahead of schedule
  • You have a desire to help people literally transform their lives
  • You are borderline obsessive about learning - constantly seeking out more books and courses that will help you grow and improve at your role.
  • You implement consistently with very little direction - doing your own research to solve problems on your own.
  • Lastly - you have an unquestioned work ethic. You aren’t afraid of hard work, because you know that it is the key to true sustainable growth... In fact - you have a very strong desire to hustle, and put in extra time and learn in your off hours.

WHO WE ARE AND ARE NOT FOR:

If you question your will to work hard, more than the normal 8-4 or 9-5 days, this probably isn’t the best position to apply for.

We hate normal jobs, and the 9-5 grind.

We believe that regular jobs suck - which is why we never want to be a regular cut-and-paste team with cubicles... or holier-than-thou mission statements... while doing little for the world.

We have big, scary goals, and are surrounding ourselves with a small tribe of rockstars that are as excited as we are about the goal, so that there is no such thing as ‘work’. We enjoy every minute of it, and want the same for all our tribemates.


BUT EVAN - WHAT WILL I BE WORKING ON?

Great question Mr. or Ms. Reader… And thank you for asking it! Let’s jump into the shoes of this role for a second .

  • Planning our weekly youtube content based on what is working across Youtube - coming up with video ideas and brief bullet point outlines for each video… So all we have to do is turn on the camera and have magical content created
  • Wrangling Evan and Benji to record the needed videos, as well as managing & working with our rockstar Video Editor and Graphic Designer to create the perfect video before it is needed
  • Creating a compelling title idea for the video, and giving graphic designer a general idea of what the thumbnail should be (based on what is already successful across Youtube)
  • Reviewing and posting new videos
  • Taking our outlines for new courses that we want to create for our students, and fleshing out the general content of each lecture we’ve outlined for you
  • Doing competitive analysis on what our competitors are doing well, and figuring out how to integrate things they are doing well into our courses to make them world-class
  • Looking at things that we could add into our current courses to increase the real and perceived value to our students
  • Basically - ideating and outlining awesome content that helps us change lives

Because we are growing insanely fast and we want to keep a very small tribe of rockstars - this will be an insane learning opportunity for the person who fits into the glass slipper.


WHAT WE DO AND DON’T CARE ABOUT

  • You’re able to work at least 20 hours a week to start, with the potential to quickly go full time once you knock our socks off.
  • Age and experience does not matter. While a firm understanding of youtube content and trends is helpful - we are looking more for qualities.
  • These qualities are humble, hungry, smart, and entrepreneurial...
  • And most importantly - a very quick learner who is wakes up excited to learn and grow.

INTERESTED?

You’re one smart cookie, my friend.

If you’re interested, here’s what to do next.

Because we get a LOT of applications for these roles, and we take getting rockstars seriously… All applications will go through a healthy vetting process and filtered through our hiring stages.

If this sounds awesome and you’re serious about this, please show it. If you’re not - please don’t bother applying.

“If you got it, flaunt it.”

- Beyonce

The first step is to fill out the application questionnaire on the next page.

If you do it right and we like your application, you’ll get into round 2 with further instructions.

Good luck and I hope to talk to you soon!

Evan

Freedom Formula

PS - if you do refer someone to this gig, we will pay you the first $2500 when they pass month 2 working full time with us and the second $2500 when they pass month 6. Just to make sure we get someone who is actually perfect for the role - because if they aren't, no-one is happy...

Apply for this position

https://freedom-formula.breezy.hr/p/57bece7589c6-content-hero-content-mastery-apprentice?source=weworkremotely

items.title: Freedom Formula: Content Hero
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

Are you looking to work with a group of rockstars around the globe, toward big scary goals that will actually make a dent in the world?

 

What about a bunch of autonomy & responsibility, and the ability to quickly learn how to run an extremely successful online business from the inside out?

 

Or even - do you know someone that sounds like this, and want my money in your pocket?

 

Hi, I'm Evan…

 

And if any of that sounds good - welcome to Freedom Formula.

 

We are a small Tribe of rockstars whose sole mission is to allow people around the world create the lives that they actually want to live by teaching them how to finally start their own business and ditch the 9-5.

 

Check us out on Youtube here if it tickles your fancy. http://bit.ly/FreedomFormulaYT

 

We are growing extremely quickly - and would like to bring on someone just like you to help us keep up the crazy pace.

 

Someone that has an insatiable desire for learning how to master compelling Youtube content…

 

Who wants to create immense value that will literally change people’s lives…

 

Skills which are at the heart of today’s most influential figures and businesses...

 

Sound cool? Cool.

 

Find out more here, and apply if you're ready to go fast and have fun. http://bit.ly/FFcontenthero

Apply:
